section.name: JBoss Seam Integration
section.p: The EJB3 cartridge now has the ability to enable your EJB 3.0 components as Seam components. This latest addition is work in progress.
Here is the initial roadmap for JBoss Seam integration from the forum.
Remember: You must set the persistenceProviderExtensions namespace property such that Hibernate validator specific annotations are generated.

subsection.name: Seam Roadmap
subsection.p: 1. Have a new profile called andromda-profile-seam, as part of the andromdaplugins project containing all stereotypes and tagged values pertaining to seam components. Projects need to download and build the artifact and manually load the profile module within their UML model.
2. Every entity or session bean which is to be modelled as a Seam component should have an extra <<Seam>> stereotype.
3. #2 will render the @Name stereotype with the value taken as the class name. Should provide @andromda.seam.component.name tagged value to override this.
4. Provide @andromda.seam.component.scope with enumerated values to set the scope if required, otherwise use defaults.
5. @NotNull on getters is rendered based on attribute multiplicity.

6. @Length annotation's max property is taken from @andromda.persistence.column.length tagged value. To specify a min length, set the tagged value to x,y where x is min, y is max. Need to account for this in the facade logic impl.

7. @In and @Out annotations for bijection are rendered on attributes defined on session bean class where <<In>> and <<Out>> stereotypes are modelled respectively. If attribute multiplicity is 0, 0..1, 0..*, define require property in both annotations. If attribute multiplicity is 1, 1..* define create property on @In.
8. @Create annotation rendered on session bean operation if a <<Create>> stereotype is modelled on it.
9. @Destroy annotation is rendered on a session bean operation if a <<Destroy>> stereotype is modelled on it.

10. Provide tag @andromda.seam.validation.invalid.outcome with enumerated list of values to be set on session bean operations (to render @IfInvalid) such that Hibernate Validator can validate component state before invoking action listener session bean operation (for components with @Valid annotations). @andromda.seam.validation.invalid.refreshEntities can be set to true or false and if defined, adds the refreshEntities property to the annotation.
11. <<Valid>> stereotype can be modelled on session bean attributes to render @Valid annotation for validation (see #10).

12. Modify andromdapp project generator to ask a further question: Would you like to use the JBoss Seam application framework? Only if persistence engine is ejb3, a web interface is required and interface type is JSF. This will add the jboss-seam artifact as dependency to necessary poms and include it in the ear for deployment. Perhaps include a property called seamEnabled in the andromda.xml application descriptor in the default namespace.
13. If seamEnabled (# 12), ejb-jar.xml contains necessary interceptor binding and application.xml contains the jboss-seam.jar java module definition.

14. As soon as you introduce session bean attributes, the cartridge assumes the bean is a stateful session bean. One solution would be to remove this default so that the only way to specify a session bean as a sfsb is via tagged value @andromda.service.type.

15. Stereotype <<DataModel>> can be modelled on attributes (of type java.util.List - but I don't think this can be enforced). This will render @DataModel on the attribute. An optional tagged value @andromda.seam.datatable.datamodel.name can be modelled on such attributes to defined the context variable name if more than 1 datamodel exists.

16. Stereotype <<DataModelSelection>> can be modelled on attributes to inject the selected value from the DataModel into this attribute. This will render @DataModelSelection on the attribute. An optional tagged value @andromda.seam.datatable.datamodel.selection.name can define the name of the context variable defined by the appropriate @DataModel.
17. Stereotype <<Factory>> can be modelled on session bean component operations with @andromda.seam.component.factory.context.name which is modelled on the operation to set the context variable name.

18. Stereotype <<RequestParameter>> can be modelled on session bean component attribute to indicate an attribute is to be injected with the value of a request parameter. Optional tagged value @andromda.seam.component.requestParameter.name will define the request parameter name.
19. Tagged value @andromda.seam.transaction.rollback.outcome on session bean component operation, can have multiple values to indicate that transaction set for rollback on the specified outcomes.

20. Not sure if we really need to touch the Java cartridge. If we can add a new stereotype to define a class/metafacade as a JavaBean in the EJB3 cartridge and apply the Seam component model to it, it would avoid bloating the 'simple' Java cartridge.

21. Tagged value @andromda.seam.component.conversational.ifNotBegunOutcome if set will render the ifNotBegunOutcome property of the @Conversational annotation to indicate the JSF outcome for the action if no long-running conversation is active when the component is invoked.

22. Stereotype <<Begin>> can be modelled on session bean component operations to indicate a long-running conversation started, which will render a @Begin annotation on the operation. Should define extra tagged values for ifOutcome, join, nested and pageflow properties of @Begin annotation.
23. Stereotype <<End>> can be modelled on session bean component operations to indicate the end of a long running conversation. Define tagged values for ifOutcome and evenIfException properties.
24. Define similar stereotypes/tags for jBPM tasks/processes.
25. Stereotype <<Unwrap>> modelled on attributes but is rendered on getter method of beans.
26. Everything needs to have XDOC documentation.

subsection.name: Project Generator
subsection.p: The AndroMDApp project generator from 3.2-SNAPSHOT in CVS onwards supports JBoss Seam for EJB3 and JSF for web project only. As long as you select these components, all the necessary JBoss Seam properties will be enabled in your project.

subsection.name: EJB3 Seam Profile
subsection.p: There exists a separate Seam profile that needs to be imported into your project. This profile contains the Seam specific tags and stereotypes you need to model on your components. You can get this profile by if you have checked out the latest andromda-plugins project from HEAD (follow Installation) and build the Profiles project. Once this is done, the profile will be copied to your M2 repository under M2_REPO/org/andromda/plugins/profiles/uml14/andromda-plugins-profile-seam/VERSION/. You can then import this andromda-plugins-profile-seam-VERSION.zml.zip profile into your model to utilise the Seam components.
